categories.name: Google Chrome Apps
categories.description: Vanishing in over 1 year, Google Chrome Apps were hosted or packaged web applications that ran on the Google Chrome browser. It will be over 11 years old.

categories.name: Android Things
categories.description: Running out of juice in 10 months, Android Things was an Android-based embedded operating system (originally named Brillo) aimed to run on Internet of Things (IoT) devices. It will be over 6 years old.

categories.name: Google Hangouts
categories.description: Floating belly up in 4 months, Google Hangouts was a communication platform which included messages, video chat, and VOIP features. Execution scheduled 'first half 2021'. It will be over 8 years old.

categories.name: Expeditions
categories.description: Another one bites the dust in 4 months, Expeditions is a program for providing virtual reality experiences to school classrooms through Google Cardboard viewers, allowing educators to take their students on virtual field trips. It will be almost 6 years old.

categories.name: Tour Creator
categories.description: best cryptocurrency tools

categories.name: Poly
categories.description: Another one bites the dust in 4 months, Poly was a distribution platform for creators to share 3D objects. It will be over 3 years old.

categories.name: Google Go Links
categories.description: Vanishing in 19 days, (also known as Google Short Links) was a URL shortening service. It also supported custom domain for customers of Google Workspace (formerly G Suite (formerly Google Apps)). It will be about 11 years old.

categories.name: Tilt Brush
categories.description: Killed about 1 month ago, Tilt Brush was a room-scale 3D-painting virtual-reality application available from Google, originally developed by Skillman & Hackett. . It was almost 5 years old.

categories.name: Loon
categories.description: Killed about 2 months ago, Loon was a service to provide internet access via an array of high-altitude balloons hovering in the Earth's stratsophere It was over 6 years old.

categories.name: App Maker
categories.description: Killed about 2 months ago, App Maker was a tool that allowed its users to build and deploy custom business apps easily and securely on the web without writing much code. It was about 4 years old.

categories.name: Google Cloud Print
categories.description: Killed 2 months ago, Google Cloud Print allowed users to 'print from anywhere;' to print from web, desktop, or mobile to any Google Cloud Print-connected printer. It was over 10 years old.

categories.name: Google Home Max
categories.description: Killed 3 months ago, Google Home Max was a large, stereo smart speaker with two tweeters and subwoofers, aux input, and a USB-C input (for wired ethernet) featuring Smart Sound machine learning technology. It was about 3 years old.

categories.name: Science Journal
categories.description: Killed 3 months ago, Science Journal was a mobile app that helped you run science experiments with your smartphone using the device's onboard sensors. It was over 4 years old.

categories.name: Trusted Contacts
categories.description: Killed 3 months ago, Trusted Contacts was an app that allowed users to share their location and view the location of specific users. It was almost 4 years old.
Killed 5 months ago, Google Play Music was a music and podcast streaming service, and online music locker. It was almost 9 years old.
categories.name: Google Play Music
Nest Secure
categories.description: Killed 5 months ago, Nest Secure was a security system with an alarm, keypad, and motion sensor with embedded microphone. It was almost 3 years old.

categories.name: Hire By Google
categories.description: Killed 6 months ago, Google Hire was an applicant tracking system to help small to medium businesses distribute jobs, identify and attract candidates, build strong relationships with candidates, and efficiently manage the interview process. It was about 3 years old.

Killed 6 months ago, Password Checkup provided a warning to users if they were using a username and password combination checked against over 4 billion credentials that Google knew to be unsafe. It was over 1 year old.
categories.name: Password Checkup Extension

categories.description: Killed 7 months ago, Focals were a custom-built smart glasses product with a transparent, holographic display that allowed users to read and respond to text messages, navigate turn-by-turn directions, check the weather, and integrate with third-party services like Uber and Amazon Alexa. It was over 1 year old.
categories.name: Focals by North
Sceneform SDK for Android
categories.description: Killed 8 months ago, Sceneform SDK for Android was a library and toolset for building AR scenes. It was about 2 years old.

categories.name: Google Photos Print
categories.description: Killed 9 months ago, Google Photos Print was a subscription service that automatically selected the best ten photos from the last thirty days which were mailed to user's homes. It was 5 months old.

categories.name: Pigeon Transit
categories.description: Killed 9 months ago, Pigeon Transit was a transit app that used croudsourced information about delays, crowded trains, escalator outages, live entertainment, dirty or unsafe conditions. It was almost 2 years old.
Killed 10 months ago, Enhanced 404 Pages was a JavaScript library that added suggested URLs and a search box to a website's 404 Not Found page. It was over 11 years old.
categories.name: Enhanced 404 Pages
Shoelace
categories.description: Killed 10 months ago, Shoelace was an app used to find group activities with others who share your interests. It was 11 months old.

categories.name: Neighbourly
categories.description: Killed 10 months ago, Neighbourly was a mobile app designed to help you learn about your neighborhood by asking other residents, and find out about local services and facilities in your area from people who live around you. It was almost 2 years old.

categories.name: Fabric
categories.description: Killed 10 months ago, Fabric was a platform that helped mobile teams build better apps, understand their users, and grow their business. It was over 5 years old.

categories.name: Material Theme Editor
categories.description: Killed 12 months ago, Material Theme Editor is a plugin for Sketch App which allows you to create a material based design system for your app. It was almost 2 years old.

categories.name: Google Station
categories.description: Killed about 1 year ago, Google Station is a service which gives partners an easy set of tools to roll-out Wi-Fi hotspots in public places. Google Station provides software and guidance on hardware to turn fiber connections into fast, reliable and safe Wi-Fi zones. It was over 4 years old.

categories.name: One Today
categories.description: Killed about 1 year ago, One Today was an app that allowed users to donate $1 to different organizations and discover how their donation would be used. It was almost 7 years old.

categories.name: Androidify
categories.description: Killed about 1 year ago, Androidify allowed users to create a custom Android avatar of for themselves and for others. It was almost 9 years old.

categories.name: Google Fiber TV
categories.description: Killed about 1 year ago, Google Fiber TV was an IPTV service that was bundled with Google Fiber. It was about 7 years old.

categories.name: Field Trip
categories.description: Killed about 1 year ago, Field Trip was a mobile app that acted as a virtual tour guide by cross referencing multiple sources of information to provide users information about points of interest near them. It was over 7 years old.

categories.name: Google Correlate
categories.description: Killed about 1 year ago, Google Correlate was a service that provided users information about how strongly the frequency of multiple search terms correlates with each other over a specified time interval. It was over 8 years old.

categories.name: Google Translator Toolkit
categories.description: Killed over 1 year ago, Google Translator Toolkit was a web application which allowed translators to edit and manage translations generated by Google Translate. It was over 10 years old.

categories.name: Google Fusion Tables
categories.description: Killed over 1 year ago, Google Fusion Tables was a web service for data management that provided a means for visualizing data in different charts, maps, and graphs. It was over 10 years old.

categories.name: Google Bulletin
categories.description: Killed over 1 year ago, Google Bulletin was a hyperlocal news service where users could post news from their neighborhood and allow others in the same areas to hear those stories. It was almost 2 years old.

categories.name: Touring Bird
categories.description: Killed over 1 year ago, Touring Bird was an Area 120 incubator project which helped users compare prices, book tours, tickets, and experiences, and learn about top destinations around the world. It was about 1 year old.

categories.name: Game Builder
categories.description: Killed over 1 year ago, Game Builder was a multiplayer 3D game environment for creating new games without coding experience. It was 5 months old.

categories.name: Datally
categories.description: Killed over 1 year ago, Datally (formerly Triangle) was a smart app by Google that helped you save, manage, and share your mobile data. It was over 2 years old.

Killed over 1 year ago, Google Clips was a miniature clip-on camera that could automatically capture interesting or relevant video clips determined by machine learning algorithms. It was about 2 years old.
categories.name: Google Clips
Google Daydream
categories.description: Killed over 1 year ago, Google Daydream was a virtual reality platform and set of hardware devices that worked with certain Android phones. It was almost 3 years old.

categories.name: YouTube Leanback
categories.description: Killed over 1 year ago, YouTube Leanback was an optimized version of YouTube used for television web browsers and webview application wrappers. It was about 9 years old.

categories.name: Message Center
categories.description: Killed over 1 year ago, Message Center is a web console where Gmail users view and manage spam email messages. It was almost 6 years old.

categories.name: Follow Your World
categories.description: Killed over 1 year ago, Follow Your World allowed users to register points of interest on Google Maps and receive email updates whenever the imagery is updated. It was over 8 years old.

categories.name: G Suite Training
categories.description: Killed over 1 year ago, G Suite Training (previously known as Synergyse) provided interactive and video-based training for 20 Google G Suite products in nine languages through a website and a Chrome extension. It was over 6 years old.

categories.name: YouTube Messages
categories.description: Killed over 1 year ago, YouTube Messages was a direct messaging feature that allowed users to share and discuss videos one-on-one and in groups on YouTube. It was about 2 years old.

categories.name: YouTube for Nintendo 3DS
categories.description: Killed over 1 year ago, YouTube app for Nintendo 3DS, 2DS, and New 3DS allowed users to stream YouTube videos on the portable gaming console. It was almost 6 years old.

categories.name: Works with Nest API
categories.description: Killed over 1 year ago, Works with Nest was an API that allowed external services to access and control Nest devices. This enabled the devices to be used with third-party home automation platforms and devices. It was about 5 years old.

categories.name: Google Trips
categories.description: Killed over 1 year ago, Google Trips was a mobile app that allowed users to plan for upcoming travel by facilitating flight, hotel, car, and restaurant reservations from user's email alongside summarized info about the user's destination. It was almost 3 years old.

categories.name: Hangouts on Air
categories.description: Killed over 1 year ago, Hangouts on Air allowed users to host a multi-user video call while recording and streaming the call on YouTube. It was almost 8 years old.

categories.name: Dragonfly
categories.description: Killed over 1 year ago, Dragonfly was a search engine designed to be compatible with China's state censorship provisions. It was 11 months old.

categories.name: Google Jump
categories.description: Killed over 1 year ago, Google Jump was a cloud-based VR media solution that enabled 3D-360 media production by integrating customized capture solutions with best-in-class automated stitching. It was about 4 years old.

categories.name: Blog Compass
categories.description: Killed over 1 year ago, Blog Compass was a blog management tool that integrated with WordPress and Blogger available only in India. It was 9 months old.

categories.name: Areo
categories.description: Killed over 1 year ago, Areo was a mobile app that allowed users in Bangalore, Mumbai, Delhi, Gurgaon, and Pune to order meals from nearby restaurants or schedule appointments with local service professionals, including electricians, painters, cleaners, plumbers, and more. It was about 2 years old.

categories.name: YouTube Gaming
categories.description: Killed almost 2 years ago, YouTube Gaming was a video gaming-oriented service and app for videos and live streaming. It was almost 4 years old.

categories.name: Google Cloud Messaging (GCM)
categories.description: Killed almost 2 years ago, Google Cloud Messaging (GCM) was a notification service that enabled developers to send messages between servers and client apps running on Android or Chrome. It was almost 7 years old.
Killed almost 2 years ago, Data Saver was an extension for Chrome that routed webpages through Google servers to compress and reduce the user's bandwidth. It was about 4 years old.
categories.name: Data Saver Extension for Chrome
Inbox by Gmail
categories.description: Killed almost 2 years ago, Inbox by Gmail aimed to improve email through several key features. It was almost 4 years old.

categories.name: Google+
categories.description: Killed almost 2 years ago, Google+ was an Internet-based social network. It was almost 8 years old.

categories.name: Google URL Shortener
categories.description: Killed almost 2 years ago, Google URL Shortener, also known as goo.gl, was a URL shortening service. It was over 9 years old.

Killed almost 2 years ago, Google Spotlight Stories was a app associated with a content studio with build award winning immersive storytelling experiences specifically for mobile VR headsets. It was over 5 years old.
categories.name: Google Spotlight Stories
Google Allo
categories.description: Killed almost 2 years ago, Google Allo was an instant messaging mobile app for Android, iOS, and Web with special features like a virtual assistant and encrypted mode. It was rebranded as Google Chat. It was over 2 years old.

categories.name: Google Notification Widget (Mr. Jingles)
categories.description: Killed about 2 years ago, Mr. Jingles (aka Google Notification Widget) displayed alerts and notifications from across multiple Google services. It was almost 4 years old.

Killed about 2 years ago, YouTube Video Annotations allowed video creators to add interactive commentary to their videos containing background information, branching ("choose your own adventure" style) stories, or links to any YouTube video, channel, or search results page. It was over 10 years old.
categories.name: YouTube Video Annotations
Google Realtime API
categories.description: Killed about 2 years ago, Google Realtime API provided ways to synchronise resources between devices. It operated on files stored on Google Drive. It was almost 6 years old.

categories.name: Chromecast Audio
categories.description: Killed about 2 years ago, Chromecast Audio was a device that allowed users to stream audio from any device to any speaker with an audio input. It was over 3 years old.

categories.name: Google Search Appliance
categories.description: Killed about 2 years ago, Google Search Appliance was a rack-mounted device that provided document indexing functionality. It was almost 17 years old.

categories.name: Google Nearby Notifications
categories.description: Killed over 2 years ago, Google Nearby Notifications were a proximity marketing tool using Bluetooth beacons and location-based data to serve content relevant to an Android user's real-world location. It was over 3 years old.

categories.name: Google News & Weather
categories.description: Killed over 2 years ago, Google News & Weather was a news aggregator application available on the Android and iOS operating systems. It was about 2 years old.

categories.name: Reply
categories.description: Killed over 2 years ago, Reply was a mobile app that let users insert Smart Replies (pre-defined replies) into conversations on messaging apps. It was 8 months old.

categories.name: Tez
categories.description: Killed over 2 years ago, Tez was a mobile payments service by Google, targeted at users in India. It was rebranded to Google Pay. It was 11 months old.

categories.name: Google Goggles
categories.description: Killed over 2 years ago, Google Goggles was used for searches based on pictures taken by handheld devices. It was almost 8 years old.

categories.name: Save to Google Chrome Extension
categories.description: Killed over 2 years ago, Save to Google Chrome Extension enabled you to quickly save a page link with image and tags to a Pocket-like app. It was over 2 years old.

categories.name: Google Play Newsstand
categories.description: Killed almost 3 years ago, Google Play Newsstand was a news aggregator and digital newsstand service. It was over 4 years old.

categories.name: Encrypted Search
categories.description: Killed almost 3 years ago, Encrypted Search provided users with anonymous internet searching. It was almost 8 years old.

categories.name: qpx-express-API
categories.description: Killed almost 3 years ago, A service that Google developed for long-tail travel clients. ITA Software will create a new, easier way for users to find better flight information online, which should encourage more users to make their flight purchases online. It was almost 8 years old.

categories.name: Google Site Search
categories.description: Killed almost 3 years ago, Google's Site Search was a service that enabled any website to add a custom search field powered by Google. It was over 9 years old.

categories.name: reCAPTCHA Mailhide
categories.description: Killed almost 3 years ago, reCAPTCHA Mailhide allowed users to mask their email address behind a captcha to prevent robots from scraping the email and sending spam. It was almost 8 years old.

categories.name: SoundStage
categories.description: Killed about 3 years ago, SoundStage was a virtual reality music sandbox built specifically for room-scale VR. It was over 1 year old.

categories.name: Project Tango
categories.description: Killed about 3 years ago, Project Tango was an API for augmented reality apps that was killed and replaced by ARCore. It was about 3 years old.

categories.name: Google Portfolios
categories.description: Killed over 3 years ago, Portfolios was a feature available in Google Finance to track personal financial securities. It was over 11 years old.
Killed over 3 years ago, YouTube Video Editor was a web-based tool for editing, merging, and adding special effects to video content. It was over 7 years old.
categories.name: YouTube Video Editor
Trendalyzer
categories.description: Killed over 3 years ago, Trendalyzer was a data trend viewing platform. It was over 10 years old.

categories.name: Glass OS
categories.description: Killed over 3 years ago, Glass OS (Google XE) was a version of Google's Android operating system designed for Google Glass. It was about 4 years old.

categories.name: Google Map Maker
categories.description: Killed almost 4 years ago, Google Map Maker was a mapping and map editing service where users were able to draw features directly onto a map. It was almost 9 years old.

categories.name: Chromebook Pixel
categories.description: Killed about 4 years ago, Chromebook Pixel was a first-of-its-kind laptop built by Google that ran Chrome OS, a Linux kernel-based operating system. It was about 4 years old.

categories.name: Google Spaces
categories.description: Killed about 4 years ago, Google Spaces was an app for group discussions and messaging. It was 9 months old.

categories.name: Google Hands Free
categories.description: Killed about 4 years ago, Google Hands Free was a mobile payment system that allowed users to pay their bill using Bluetooth to connect to payment terminals by saying 'I'll pay with Google.' It was 11 months old.

categories.name: Gesture Search
categories.description: Killed about 4 years ago, Google Gesture Search allowed users to search contacts, applications, settings, music and bookmark on their Android device by drawing letters or numbers onto the screen. It was almost 7 years old.

categories.name: Panoramio
categories.description: Killed over 4 years ago, Panoramio was a geo-location tagging and photo sharing product. It was about 11 years old.

categories.name: Google Showtimes
categories.description: Killed over 4 years ago, Google Showtimes was a standalone movie search result page. It was about 11 years old.

categories.name: Pixate
categories.description: Killed over 4 years ago, Pixate was a platform for creating sophisticated animations and interactions, and refine your designs through 100% native prototypes for iOS and Android. It was over 4 years old.

categories.name: Google Nexus
categories.description: Killed over 4 years ago, Google Nexus was Google's line of flagship Android phones, tablets, and accessories. It was over 6 years old.

categories.name: Together
categories.description: Killed over 4 years ago, Together was a watch face for Android Wear that let two users link their watches together to share small visual messages. It was about 1 year old.

categories.name: Project Ara
categories.description: Killed over 4 years ago, Project Ara was a modular smartphone project under development by Google. It was almost 3 years old.

categories.name: Web Hosting in Google Drive
categories.description: Killed over 4 years ago, Web hosting in Google Drive was a method of uploading HTML, CSS and other files in order to publish live web sites. It was almost 4 years old.

categories.name: Google Swiffy
categories.description: Killed over 4 years ago, Google Swiffy was a web-based tool that converted SWF files to HTML5. It was about 5 years old.

categories.name: Google Wallet Card
categories.description: Killed over 4 years ago, Google Wallet Card was a prepaid debit card that let users pay for things in person and online using their Wallet balance at any retailer that accepted MasterCard. It was over 2 years old.

categories.name: Nexus Player
categories.description: Killed almost 5 years ago, Nexus Player was a digital media player that allowed users to play music, watch video originating from Internet services or a local network, and play games. It was over 1 year old.

categories.name: Revolv
categories.description: Killed almost 5 years ago, Revolv was a monitoring and control system that allowed users to control their connected devices from a single hub. It was about 4 years old.

categories.name: Freebase
categories.description: Killed almost 5 years ago, Freebase was a large collaborative knowledge base consisting of structured data composed mainly by its community members, developed by Metaweb(acquired by Google). It was about 9 years old.

categories.name: Google Now
categories.description: Killed almost 5 years ago, Google Now was a feature of Google Search that offered predictive cards with information and daily updates in Chrome and the Google app for Android and iOS. It was almost 4 years old.

categories.name: MyTracks
categories.description: Killed almost 5 years ago, MyTracks was a GPS tracking application for Android which allowed users to track their path, speed, distance and elevation. It was about 7 years old.

categories.name: uWeave
categories.description: Killed almost 5 years ago, uWeave (pronounced “micro weave”) was an implementation of the Weave protocol intended for use on microcontroller based devices. It was 4 months old.

categories.name: Google Compare
categories.description: Killed about 5 years ago, Google Compare allowed consumers to compare several offers ranging from insurance, mortgage, and credit cards. It was about 1 year old.

categories.name: Pie
categories.description: Killed about 5 years ago, Pie was a work-centric groupchat website and app comparable to Slack. It was over 2 years old.

categories.name: Google Maps Engine
categories.description: Killed about 5 years ago, Google Maps Engine was an online tool for map creation. It enabled you to create layered maps using your own data as well as Google Maps data. It was over 2 years old.

categories.name: Songza
categories.description: Killed about 5 years ago, Songza was a free music streaming service that would recommend its users various playlists based on time of day and mood or activity. It was about 8 years old.

categories.name: Google Code
categories.description: Killed about 5 years ago, Google Code was a service that provided revision control, an issue tracker, and a wiki for code documentation. It was almost 11 years old.
Killed about 5 years ago, Google Blog Search API was a way to search blogs utilizing Google. It was over 10 years old.
categories.name: Google Blog Search API
Google Earth Browser Plug-in
categories.description: Killed over 5 years ago, Google Earth Browser Plug-in allowed developers to embed Google Earth into web pages and included a JavaScript API for custom 3D drawing and interaction. It was over 7 years old.

categories.name: Timeful
categories.description: Killed over 5 years ago, Timeful was an iOS to do list and calendar application, developed to reinvent the way that people manage their most precious resource of time. It was almost 4 years old.

categories.name: Picasa
categories.description: Killed over 5 years ago, Picasa was an image organizer and image viewer for organizing and editing digital photos. It was almost 13 years old.

categories.name: Google Flu Trends
categories.description: Killed over 5 years ago, Google Flu Trends was a service attempting to make accurate predictions about flu activity. It was almost 7 years old.

categories.name: Google Catalogs
categories.description: Killed over 5 years ago, Google Catalogs was a shopping application that delivered the virtual catalogs of large retailers to users. It was almost 4 years old.

categories.name: Google Moderator
categories.description: Killed over 5 years ago, Google Moderator was a service that used crowdsourcing to rank user-submitted questions, suggestions and ideas. It was almost 7 years old.

categories.name: Android @ Home
categories.description: Killed almost 6 years ago, Android @ Home allowed a user’s device to discover, connect, and communicate with devices and appliances in the home. It was about 4 years old.
Killed almost 6 years ago, Google Helpouts was an online collaboration service where users could share their expertise through live video. It was over 1 year old.
categories.name: Google Helpouts
BebaPay
categories.description: Killed almost 6 years ago, BebaPay was a form of electronic ticketing platform in Nairobi, Kenya that was developed by Google in partnership with Equity Bank. It was almost 2 years old.

categories.name: Google Play Edition
categories.description: Killed about 6 years ago, Google Play Edition devices were a series of Android smartphones and tablets sold by Google. It was over 1 year old.

categories.name: Google Glass Explorer Edition
categories.description: Killed about 6 years ago, Google Glass Explorer Edition was a wearable computer with an optical head-mounted display and camera that allows the wearer to interact with various applications and the Internet via natural language voice commands. It was almost 2 years old.

categories.name: Word Lens
categories.description: Killed about 6 years ago, Word Lens translated text in real time on images by using the viewfinder of a device's camera without the need of an internet connection; The technology was rolled into Google Translate. It was about 4 years old.

categories.name: Orkut
categories.description: Killed over 6 years ago, Orkut was a social network designed to help users meet new and old friends and maintain existing relationships. It was over 10 years old.

categories.name: Google TV
categories.description: Killed over 6 years ago, Google TV was a smart TV platform that integrated Android and Chrome to create an interactive television overlay. It was over 3 years old.

categories.name: Quickoffice
categories.description: Killed over 6 years ago, Quickoffice was a productivity suite for mobile devices which allowed the viewing, creating and editing of documents, presentations and spreadsheets. It was 9 months old.

categories.name: Google Questions and Answers
categories.description: Killed over 6 years ago, Google Questions and Answers was a free knowledge market that allowed users to collaboratively find answers to their questions. It was almost 7 years old.

categories.name: Wildfire Interactive
categories.description: Killed almost 7 years ago, Wildfire by Google was a social marketing application that enabled businesses to create, optimize and measure their presence on social networks. It was over 1 year old.

categories.name: BufferBox
categories.description: Killed about 7 years ago, BufferBox was a Canadian startup that provided consumers 24/7 convenience of picking up their online purchases. It was about 1 year old.

categories.name: SlickLogin
categories.description: Killed about 7 years ago, SlickLogin was an Israeli start-up company which developed sound-based password alternatives, was acquired by Google and hasn't released anything since. It was 7 months old.

categories.name: Google Schemer
categories.description: Killed about 7 years ago, Google Schemer was a Google service for sharing and discovering things to do. It was over 2 years old.
Killed about 7 years ago, Google Chrome Frame was a plugin for Internet Explorer that allowed web pages to be displayed using WebKit and the V8 JavaScript engine. It was over 3 years old.
categories.name: Google Chrome Frame
Google Notifier
categories.description: Killed about 7 years ago, Google Notifier alerted users to new emails on their Gmail account. It was about 9 years old.

categories.name: Bump!
categories.description: Killed about 7 years ago, Bump! is a discontinued iOS and Android mobile app that enables smartphone users to transfer contact information, photos and files between devices. It was almost 5 years old.

categories.name: Google Offers
categories.description: Killed about 7 years ago, Google Offers was a service offering discounts and coupons. Initially, it was a deal of the day website similar to Groupon. It was over 2 years old.

categories.name: Google Currents
categories.description: Killed over 7 years ago, Google Currents was a social magazine app by google, which was replaced by Google Play Newsstand. It was almost 2 years old.

categories.name: Google Checkout
categories.description: Killed over 7 years ago, Google Checkout was an online payment processing service that aimed to simplify the process of paying for online purchases. It was over 7 years old.

categories.name: Google Trader
categories.description: Killed over 7 years ago, Google Trader was a classifieds service run by Google in Ghana, Uganda, Kenya and Nigeria to help customers trade goods and services online. It was almost 3 years old.

categories.name: iGoogle
categories.description: Killed over 7 years ago, iGoogle was a customizable Ajax-based start page or personal web portal. It was over 8 years old.

categories.name: Google Latitude
categories.description: Killed over 7 years ago, Google Latitude was a location-aware feature of Google Maps, a successor to an earlier SMS-based service Dodgeball. It was over 4 years old.

categories.name: Google Reader
categories.description: Killed over 7 years ago, Google Reader was a RSS/Atom feed aggregator. It was over 7 years old.

categories.name: Nexus Q
categories.description: Killed over 7 years ago, Nexus Q was a digital media player that allowed users with Android devices to stream content from supported services to a connected television or speakers via an integrated amplifier. It was about 1 year old.

categories.name: Punchd
categories.description: Killed almost 8 years ago, Punchd was a digital loyalty card app and service targeted towards small businesses that originated as a student project at Cal Poly in 2009 and was acquired by Google in 2011. It was almost 2 years old.

categories.name: Building Maker
categories.description: Killed almost 8 years ago, Building Maker enabled users to create 3D models of buildings for Google Earth on the browser. It was over 3 years old.

categories.name: Google Talk
categories.description: Killed almost 8 years ago, Often remembered as 'Gchat', Google Talk was a messaging service for both text and voice using XMPP. It was over 7 years old.

categories.name: Google SMS
categories.description: Killed almost 8 years ago, Google SMS let you text questions- including weather, sports scores, word definitions, and more- to 466453 and get an answer back. It was over 8 years old.

categories.name: Google Cloud Connect
categories.description: Killed almost 8 years ago, Google Cloud Connect was a free cloud computing plugin for multiple versions of Microsoft Office that automatically stored and synchronized files to Google Docs. It was about 5 years old.

categories.name: Picnik
categories.description: Killed almost 8 years ago, Picnik was an online photo editing service that allowed users to edit, style, crop, and resize images. It was over 6 years old.

categories.name: Google Chart API
categories.description: Killed about 8 years ago, Google Chart API was an interactive Web service that created graphical charts from user-supplied data. It was about 5 years old.
Killed about 8 years ago, Google Mini was a smaller version of the Google Search Appliance. It was about 5 years old.
categories.name: Google Mini
